https://twitter.com/anton_gribov3Tweethttps://twitter.com/anton_gribov3/status/974492720097120256https://twitter.com/anton_gribov3/status/974967159498723328Retweethttps://twitter.com/socialmedia_mrk/status/974616843146145793https://twitter.com/socialmedia_mrk/status/973997235859050499https://twitter.com/socialmedia_mrk/status/974133106516078592https://twitter.com/socialmedia_mrk/status/973770709712371715https://twitter.com/socialmedia_mrk/status/976072690636378113Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100008780564887Reposthttps://www.facebook.com/permalink.php?story_fbid=1814789002157101&id=100008780564887https://www.facebook.com/permalink.php?story_fbid=1814788975490437&id=100008780564887https://www.facebook.com/permalink.php?story_fbid=1815205328782135&id=100008780564887https://www.facebook.com/permalink.php?story_fbid=1815777515391583&id=100008780564887https://www.facebook.com/permalink.php?story_fbid=1815777318724936&id=100008780564887 This is really good advice, because I myself was on the verge of selling all my coins because I almost lost all my belief that the dump would ever end.. I think it's too early to think about when the crypt will die, I'm sure it will not be soon and the crypt is only at the stage of its formation. The situation on the market is now fundamentally changing in a positive way, but I have always been confident in the coins in which I invested. Among them, Ripple, Waves and NEO. According to the fact that now on the market there are more than a half of the coins completely worthless and almost ready to disappear from the stock exchanges, I think that your forecasts is true. I'm very glad that I did not sell all my coins during the last long dump and the Ethereum now looks even more confident than Bitcoin. I prefer the short term investment, but there are a few that I would  buy for the long term, and this is definitely NEO and the Ethereum. it's a goodwallet and it still works, I prefer to use it only, although I'm strongly recommended to use at least a few different wallets. I totally agree with the fact that NEO is a very promising coin and I think that it is necessary to buy it for a long-term perspective on average for a year Try to enter the crypt using a cascading method, this is when you focus on one coin, but you do not buy coins with all the money at once, but for a few weeks or months. I'm familiar with the first three sites, but for me the most reliable and convenient Internet resource is investapedia.com. I think that together with the stabilization of the market, the situation with ICO will also improve. While the biggest problem is  so many of skam in the crypt. I think that the most successful team is still the NEO team, they are very successful in promoting their coins and it is becoming more popular outside the Asian countries. Do not worry  so much, because I'm sure that literally every trader has such decisions, which he regrets. Here you can not foresee everything. I think that the most promising now is NEO, Stellar and Ethereum which now need to be bought while they are on the dump. Binance and Bitrex are the most convenient for me and I use two. Others did not use, may be there are something better I'm sure that the future is for the altcoins. Now there are a lot of new coins, but those that are now on the market is the basis of the whole crypt. I think that the answer is obvious and this is the Ethereum, because it is becoming more popular than Bitcoin and I am sure that in the future ETH will overtake BTC in capitalization. In fact, the principle is not entirely clear if you understand the essence, so please tell it. But the idea is quite interesting. Yes, the crypt becomes very popular and more people start participating in bounty campaigns, but I'm more worried about the fact there are even more scams. I'm sure that this is just rumors, and the Ethereum will go down in price  to 500 bucks. I think that this is FUD, so do not rush to sell. https://www.facebook.com/permalink.php?story_fbid=1811810379121630&id=100008780564887 I'm sure that the Ethereum will overtake bitcoin by the end of the month. I plan to invest in ETH  in the near future. I noticed that the prices of altcoins began to grow   and now is just a very good time to buy a few coins. I would buy an Ethereum
Airdrop is an opportunity to freely and completely effortlessly get tokens that are likely to rise in price at the exchange and bring a good profit For a good project, the product is the most important, because this is what the money is for. Well, if it's scammers, then of course not If we talk about the easiest way to earn money in crypt, then this is definitely airdrops. Because you do not risk anything, but wait for tokens or coins will not be less than a month I would not advise selling NEO and Litecoin because there are forcasts with a good growth of these coins. But Im not sure about other coins I'm sure that the best thing now is to invest in the Ethereum and the fact that it is still less in price than Bitcoin plays for the benefit of small traders. I'm sure that ETH will someday overtake BTC. If you are not sure of your strengths or just a newbie in trading, then you should not invest big funds at all. I think that you can return this money with a long-term investment in the Ethereum. ###TWITTER WEEK 5: 28/02-06/03###<list of tweets/retweets>https://twitter.com/helbizofficial/status/969416920171667458https://twitter.com/helbizofficial/status/963579238782730242https://twitter.com/helbizofficial/status/963545629120258050https://twitter.com/helbizofficial/status/970867068152135681###FACEBOOK WEEK 5: 28/02-06/03###<list of shares>https://www.facebook.com/permalink.php?story_fbid=1807191379583530&id=100008780564887https://www.facebook.com/permalink.php?story_fbid=1808107582825243&id=100008780564887https://www.facebook.com/permalink.php?story_fbid=1808625129440155&id=100008780564887https://www.facebook.com/permalink.php?story_fbid=1808957232740278&id=100008780564887 I bought Ethereum in January when most of the coins were on a strong dump and I'm not going to sell it in the near future. I would not buy  ETH now, it's better to wait a bit. I mainly deal only with coins, because I was not lucky with tokens. Almost everything did not even reach exchanges. I think that working with coins is not so risky. I almost completely stopped taking part in the airdrops, because there was too much scam. I participated in December in 13 drops, of which 10 was a scam. But if someone has a good airdrops, I would have participate! I've heard about similar projects, but I still do not know how it will look in practice, because all the power of the phone will be used for mining and the phone simply cant be used. For me Ripple is the most convenient, because the coin is really cheap, quite reliable and for beginners more than the best option. I invested in Ripple for a long-term perspective and now more than pleased that I did so. When I started just doing bounty campaigns, I came across some scam, but now I have several advisers who help to choose good projects. It's really hard to choose really if you do not know much about all the characteristics. I decided to engage in crypt and for all the time I have not invested a single dollar from personal funds. Because I first earned on bounty, and then put in a few coins. I am still do both bounty and trading. I kept the Waves for a few weeks, but in January I sold the coin because the market was too unstable. Now I'm experimenting with Stellar, I'll see what happens. No it seems that I made a right decision. Maybe you want features Google Apps doesn't give you (like server side chat room bookmarks or full control over your vcard or server side logs that you can export properly or whatever else you want pretty much.  I can run a lot of different modules if you want).  Maybe you don't trust Google or don't trust servers in the states. You can get wobby@mydommy.com and use it to chat with people on XMPP/Jabber services (like GTalk, Livejournal, and probably someday soon Facebook and AIM).  You can use "transports" to talk to legacy services like MSN, but that requires an account with the legacy service so there is no real advantage over just using your accounts on those services directly in Pidgin. Something like mybitcoin.com?  Or a client-side application of some kind...? I've been hearing this for awhile, but since my miner will only computer proof of works and send those to deepbit, can deepbit really be used to attack the network using only that? I *strongly* suggest you only trade with people you trust, or at least with people who have a positive bitcoin-otc rating. You should either use DNS or XRD/LARD/WebFinger based discovery.  In an extreme case you could use the new /.well-known/ standard, but really this is exactly a use case for XRD/WebFinger. Yeah.  There are definite trust issues, but there are anyway.  I like https://www.instawallet.org for this sort of thing, because it's so easy for a new user to set up.  Just visit the site and bookmark it.  Done. This seems like a really interesting idea, but you might want to give more details.  How does this end up being different from bidding pond?  Do people just sign up as "I can proxy buy gift cards for X"? That's unfortunate.Really?  That's rather suprising, since my CPU can do 4Mhash/sec I just installed this on my Ubuntu 10.10 system with an Nvidia Quadro NVS 290 in it.  When I run without -d it lists only one device, 0, the Quadro NVS 290.  When I run with -d 0 it uses 100% of a core (slowing the system quite a bit) and only gets an abysmal 2300khash/sec.  Am I doing something wrong?  Is there something else I need to install?I also tried DiabloMiner with identical results. People interested in this may also like https://github.com/singpolyma/mnemonicodeIt currently only does raw bytes or hex, but if there's a bitcoin address decoder around (or if you just feed in the ASCII) you will get words  c2s would be TLS for sure.  s2s would be TLS if the other server supports it.  I could turn on forcing s2s tls for your domain if you want, but then you can't connect to servers that don't support it.I could generate a self-signed cert for you, but those aren't very useful imho.  I could run my own CA, but I don't really have a good reason to bother.  startssl or cacert will get you one for free Good questions!  Some of this I mean to cover in the OP.  You must have a domain (or subdomain, or whatever.  You can get a free one from co.cc if you don't want to pay $10/yr for a domain).  If people are interested in proxy-registering domains for BTC I could offer that as a seperate service.  You do NOT, however, need to point your A records at my server.  You can host your domain primarily anywhere else you want, you only need to add some SRV records to your DNS to tell it where the XMPP server is.  In this case the records to add are:_xmpp-client._tcp 900 IN SRV 5 0 5222 singpolyma.net._xmpp-server._tcp 900 IN SRV 5 0 5269 singpolyma.net._jabber._tcp      900 IN SRV 5 0 5269 singpolyma.net.It is possible to use gateways.  I do not currently run the gateways, but if that's something people are interested in I could look at it.  I do know some servers offer the gateways publicly, so you could at very least use those even with your account being on my server.My server is a dedicated box from iWeb living in their data centre on the Montreal Island in Canada with a 10 Mbps ethernet connection to their infrastructure. I am selling XMPP hosting for domains.  1 BTC/monthThis service allows you to have one or more addresses you@yourdomain.tld that are on the XMPP/Jabber network.  This is the same network that GTalk is on, and you will be able to chat with GTalk users from your accounts.Unlimited accounts per domain.TLS supported, but you must provide your own cert.Server will run the latest version of Prosody.imDiscussion/questions on this thread are appreciated.  Please send any orders to xmpp-hosting@singpolyma.net Is it possible to make this work with ATI Radeon HD 2600 XT ?  I think I installed it right, but it only lists my CPU as an option for OpenCL device. The use case was mostly that we have tx to IP (and can only send a memo when going to an IP) and so it seems like whatever reasons there are for sending to IP apply even better to DNS names (for those of us with dynamic IPs). Closed source implementations can exist no matter what license you use (they can just reimplement).
